p01.opening: I’m with you and I’m tracking.
p01.closing: We can stay right here — no need to decide anything now.

p01.opening: I’ll help you sort this, not decide for you.
p01.middle: Let’s name what matters and pause right there.
p01.closing: We can simply keep company; if helpful, a brief settle is there — your call.

p02.middle: I’ll mirror back clearly and keep advice off until you ask.
p02.closing: We can linger here; you can let it be as it is, or rest on one steady point — your pace.

p01.opening: Let’s make the moment a little steadier.
p01.middle: Name one color you see and take one soft breath.

p02.opening: We’ll soften the pace a touch.
p02.middle: Inhale for four, exhale for six, once or twice.

p01.opening: This is a lot — let’s slow everything down together.
p01.middle: Stay with one safe thing: your breath, a color, a steady touch.
p01.closing: If safety is in question, please reach local supports. You matter.

p02.opening: I’m here; we’ll take it gently.
p02.middle: Chair, feet, breath — pick one to rest on for a moment.
p02.closing: If there’s danger, contact a trusted person or local services now.

short: That’s enough for now; pausing is okay.
No rush to fix anything — steady first.
You can say no if it feels too much.
Stay only as long as you like.
A tiny bit is already plenty.
We can come back later; resting is allowed.
medium: Keep the pace light and stop where it feels right.
You can leave the rest for later; that’s valid.
It’s okay to choose not to do this right now.
long: Do what’s doable today and set the rest down.
Your pace leads; if you want to pause, I’m here.

pool: Let’s keep attention in the body,

short: Find a calm color and breathe with it once.
Hand on chest, notice one gentle exhale.
Feel the chair or your feet for three seconds.
Place attention on one safe touch point.
Roll the shoulders softly once or twice.
medium: Sip water or glance out the window for a beat.
Shrink the task to one breath’s first step.
Name three colors you see, then one longer exhale.
long: Choose one tiny, kind action — or skip it for now.
Rest on breath and body support for a couple cycles.
